Legal_Issue: Do the applicants qualify as Convention refugees due to a well-founded fear of persecution upon returning to Cuba?
Governing_Law: Convention relating to the Status of Refugees
Evidence_Type: Applicants' testimony, visa and exit permit documents
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of imprisonment upon return to Cuba
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Punishment for violating law of general application not linked to Convention reason
Decision_Maker: Refugee Division, Immigration and Refugee Board
Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 97(1)
Assessment_Standard: Objective basis for fear of persecution
Legal_Standard: Persecution requires disproportionate punishment linked to a Convention ground
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether punishment for visa overstay constitutes persecution
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Violation of law of general application not persecution unless disproportionate and linked to Convention reason
Cause_of_Refusal: Fear based on general law violation, not persecution
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of refugee status based on fear of detention

Violation_Type: Failure to comply with conditions of temporary stay
Legal_Issue: Do the applicants have a well-founded fear of persecution due to potential imprisonment for overstaying their exit permits?
Application_Facts: Applicants left Cuba legally but overstayed their exit permits
Court_Ruling: No well-founded fear of persecution established
Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada beyond authorized period
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under the Refugee Convention
Assessment_Factor: Nature and severity of penalty for immigration violations
Application_Basis: Fear of state punishment upon return
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of evidence showing disproportionate punishment
Governing_Rule: Punishment for general law violation not persecution without disproportionate impact and nexus to Convention ground
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof that imprisonment would be arbitrary or discriminatory
Harm_Assessment: Potential imprisonment not rising to level of persecution
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee status fearing punishment for overstaying Cuban exit permits
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed risk of detention in Cuba
Evidence_Issues: No evidence of targeted or discriminatory enforcement
Residency_Compliance: Failed to return within permitted timeframe
Decision_Rationale: Penalty for overstaying is administrative or criminal sanction under general law, not persecution
Decision_Making_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board – Refugee Division
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of country evidence on enforcement practices
